input_sentence: ego vehicle will not exceed the speed limit of the lane it is driving on and it will not exceed the maximum velocity allowed for its vehicle type and ego will not exceed the speed limit such that it can no longer react to traffic regulations and restrictions.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle exceeds the speed limit of the lane it is driving on
Ego vehicle exceeds the maximum velocity allowed for its vehicle type
Ego vehicle cannot react to traffic regulations and restrictions
Ego vehicle is driving on the lane

temporal_relations.description: Ego will not exceed the speed limit of the lane it is driving on
Ego will not exceed the maximum velocity allowed for its vehicle type
Ego will not exceed the speed limit such that it can no longer react to traffic regulations

lexicon.ego_exceeds_lane_speed: Ego vehicle exceeds lane speed limit
lexicon.ego_exceeds_max_velocity: Ego vehicle exceeds maximum velocity for vehicle type
lexicon.ego_cannot_react: Ego vehicle cannot react to traffic regulations
lexicon.ego_on_lane: Ego vehicle is driving on the lane

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_lane → lane

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)  (binary predicate with related_object)
   - ap_2: exceeds_max_velocity(ego)  (unary predicate)
   - ap_3: cannot_react_to_regulations(ego)  (unary predicate)  
   - ap_4: driving_on(ego,lane)  (binary predicate with related_object)

3. Process temporal relations by substituting atomic propositions with their predicate forms:
   - Relation 1: driving_on(ego,lane) -> ~exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)
   - Relation 2: true -> ~exceeds_max_velocity(ego)
   - Relation 3: true -> ~(exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) & cannot_react_to_regulations(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to all constraints

Final MTL Formula:
G(driving_on(ego,lane) -> ~exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)) & G(~exceeds_max_velocity(ego)) & G(~(exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) & cannot_react_to_regulations(ego)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_lane → lane

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)  (binary predicate with related_object)
   - ap_2: exceeds_max_velocity(ego)  (unary predicate)
   - ap_3: cannot_react_to_regulations(ego)  (unary predicate)  
   - ap_4: driving_on(ego,lane)  (binary predicate with related_object)

3. Process temporal relations by substituting atomic propositions with their predicate forms:
   - Relation 1: driving_on(ego,lane) -> ~exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)
   - Relation 2: true -> ~exceeds_max_velocity(ego)
   - Relation 3: true -> ~(exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) & cannot_react_to_regulations(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to all constraints

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
[The formula consists of three conjunctive clauses with global temporal operators. I interpret each predicate as follows:
- driving_on(ego,lane) → "ego vehicle is driving on the lane"
- exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) → "ego vehicle exceeds the speed limit for the lane"
- exceeds_max_velocity(ego) → "ego vehicle exceeds maximum velocity for vehicle type"
- cannot_react_to_regulations(ego) → "ego vehicle cannot react to traffic regulations"

The formula uses three G (globally) operators with implications and negations:
1. First clause: G(driving_on(ego,lane) -> ~exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)) - When ego is driving on lane, it must not exceed lane speed limit
2. Second clause: G(~exceeds_max_velocity(ego)) - Ego must never exceed maximum velocity
3. Third clause: G(~(exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) & cannot_react_to_regulations(ego))) - Ego cannot simultaneously exceed speed limit and be unable to react to regulations

All three conditions must hold globally (always).]

Natural Language Translation:
[Always, if the ego vehicle is driving on the lane, then it must not exceed the speed limit for that lane; and always, the ego vehicle must not exceed the maximum velocity for its vehicle type; and always, the ego vehicle cannot both exceed the speed limit for the lane and be unable to react to traffic regulations at the same time.]

verification_result.back_translation: [Always, if the ego vehicle is driving on the lane, then it must not exceed the speed limit for that lane; and always, the ego vehicle must not exceed the maximum velocity for its vehicle type; and always, the ego vehicle cannot both exceed the speed limit for the lane and be unable to react to traffic regulations at the same time.]

- exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) → "ego vehicle exceeds the speed limit for the lane"
- exceeds_max_velocity(ego) → "ego vehicle exceeds maximum velocity for vehicle type"
- cannot_react_to_regulations(ego) → "ego vehicle cannot react to traffic regulations"

The formula uses three G (globally) operators with implications and negations:
1. First clause: G(driving_on(ego,lane) -> ~exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane)) - When ego is driving on lane, it must not exceed lane speed limit
2. Second clause: G(~exceeds_max_velocity(ego)) - Ego must never exceed maximum velocity
3. Third clause: G(~(exceeds_speed_limit(ego,lane) & cannot_react_to_regulations(ego))) - Ego cannot simultaneously exceed speed limit and be unable to react to regulations

All three conditions must hold globally (always).]

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
